markDown.title: Expanders
markDown.subtitle: Did you mean accordions?
markDown.content:
## What are expanders?

An expander is an expandable UI component that reveals and hides the content contained within as the result of a click action.

Expanders give the user a sense of what content they contain without necessarily forcing the user to actually view all of the expander's content. Because they conserve vertical space, expanders can be especially good for mobile.

Expanders generally work best when they ask the user to focus on a single task or a very small number of closely related tasks. That's why it's not a good practice to nest a table, tabs, or another expander inside of an expander.

<hr>

<!-- ###### Developer Documentation

*   [Live Examples](http://zui.zywave.com-expander/)
*   [View in Gitlab](https://gitlab.zywave.com/zui/zui-expander/)

## Terminology

We define four types of expanders—standard, lightweight, pop-out, and peek-a-boo—which we define in more detail below. In order to better understand their similarities and differences, we use the following terminology to refer to the parts of an expander:

![Terminology](/images/components/expanders/terminology.svg)

<Grid>

<GridCol col="span-6">

**Expander**: an expandable UI element composed of multiple sections.

**Section**: an element, consisting of a header and a content area, that makes up an expander. All expanders (except for peek-a-boos) consist of at least two sections.

**Header**: the element that contains a label and additional elements—an icon, an action, and/or content details—that give the user the information they need to determine how and whether to expand a section.

**Action icon**: an icon appearing in the header that indicates the section can be expanded and collapsed.

</GridCol>

<GridCol col="span-6">

**Content details:** Read-only information visible in the header even when the section is collapsed.

**Content area:** the area that appears when a header is expanded.

**Label:** the name of an expander section.

**Content:** information inside of the content area.

</GridCol>

</Grid>

<hr>

## Types of expanders

Each of the four types of expanders has some distinct features, which means that some expanders are a better fit for some situations than others.

<Grid>

<GridCol col="span-6">

### Standard expander

The most common expander.  
[More details](#standard)

![Plain Standard Expander](/images/components/expanders/plain__standard.svg)

</GridCol>

<GridCol col="span-6">

### Pop-out expander

Focuses the user's attention on one section at a time.  
[More details](#popout)

![Plain Popout Expander](/images/components/expanders/plain__popout.svg)

</GridCol>

<GridCol col="span-6">

### Lightweight expander

Draws less attention to itself, often used for filters.  
[More details](#lightweight)

![Plain Lightweight Expander](/images/components/expanders/plain__lightweight.svg)

</GridCol>

<GridCol col="span-6">

### Peek-a-boo expander

A single-section expander that hides some of its content.  
[More details](#peekaboo)

![Plain Peekaboo Expander](/images/components/expanders/plain__peekaboo.svg)

</GridCol>

</Grid>

<hr>

## Standard expander

### Overview

- Has a container
- Opens/closes by clicking anywhere in the header
- Can be one of multiple sections open at a time
- The most widely applicable expander type

![Standard Expander Specs](/images/components/expanders/specs__standard.svg)

All values are in pixels. X represents the height of the content area, which will vary based upon the height of the content inside of the section.

### States

<Grid>

<GridCol col="span-6">

![Gray Standard Expander](/images/components/expanders/gray__standard.svg)

Standard expanders on a gray background

##### Collapsed:

- Header background: #FFFFFF
- Header label: #7A7A7A

##### Hover:

- Header background: #FAFAFA
- Header label: #3D3D3D

##### Expanded:

- Header background: #FFFFFF
- Content area background: #FFFFFF
- Header label: #3D3D3D
- Action icon: Rotated 180 degrees

</GridCol>

<GridCol col="span-6">

![White Standard Expander](/images/components/expanders/white__standard.svg)

Standard expanders on a white background

##### Collapsed:

- Header background: #FAFAFA
- Header label: #7A7A7A

##### Hover:

- Header background: #F4F4F4
- Header label: #3D3D3D

##### Expanded:

- Header background: #FFFFFF
- Content area background: #FFFFFF
- Header label: #3D3D3D
- Action icon: Rotated 180 degrees

</GridCol>

</Grid>

### Variations

- By default all sections are closed, but you can customize to defaulting a section open.
- Defaults to one section to open at a time, but can customize to have multiple open at a time.

<hr>

## Pop-out expander

### Overview

- Has a container
- Only one section can be opened at a time
- Opens/closes when clicking the the action only
- Often contains read-only details in the header
- Forces the user to focus on one section at a time

### Sizing and spacing

![Popout Expander Specs](/images/components/expanders/specs__popout.svg)

All values are in pixels. X represents the height of the content area, which will vary based upon the height of the content inside of the section.

### Mobile

<Grid>

<GridCol col="span-6">

Because of limited space, the mobile pop-out expander doesn't get any wider when expanded.

</GridCol>

<GridCol col="span-6">

![Popout Expander Mobile](/images/components/expanders/mobile__popout.svg)

</GridCol>

</Grid>

### States

<Grid>

<GridCol col="span-6">

![Gray Popout Expander](/images/components/expanders/gray__popout.svg)

Popout expanders on a gray background

##### Collapsed:

- Header background: #FFFFFF
- Header label: #7A7A7A

##### Hover:

- Header background: no change
- Header label: no change
- Header action: uses button hover

##### Expanded:

- Header background: #FFFFFF
- Content area background: #FFFFFF
- Header label: #3D3D3D

</GridCol>

<GridCol col="span-6">

![White Pop-out Expander](/images/components/expanders/white__popout.svg)

Popout expanders on a white background

##### Collapsed:

- Header background: #FAFAFA
- Header label: #7A7A7A

##### Hover:

- Header background: no change
- Header label: no change
- Header action: uses button hover

##### Expanded:

- Header background: #FFFFFF
- Content area background: #FFFFFF
- Header label: #3D3D3D

</GridCol>

</Grid>

<hr>

## Lightweight expander

### Overview

- No container
- Can be one or multiple sections open at a time
- Opens/closes by clicking the label or action
- Doesn't draw attention to itself

### Sizing and spacing

![Lightweight Expander Specs](/images/components/expanders/specs__lightweight.svg)

All values are in pixels. X represents the height of the content area, which will vary based upon the height of the content inside of the section.

### States

<Grid>

<GridCol col="span-6">

![White Lightweight Expander](/images/components/expanders/white__lightweight.svg)

Lightweight expanders on a white background

##### Collapsed:

- Header label: #7A7A7A

##### Hover:

- Header label: #3D3D3D

##### Expanded:

- Header label: #3D3D3D
- Action icon: Rotated 90 degrees

</GridCol>

</Grid>

<hr>

## Peek-a-boo expander

### Overview

- Only one section
- Appears in the middle of content; only hides some
- Opens/closes by clicking the header or action
- Header slides below to reveal content
- Doesn't draw attention to itself

### Sizing and spacing

![](/images/components/expanders/specs__peekaboo.svg)

All values are in pixels. X represents the height of the content area, which will vary based upon the height of the content inside of the section.

### States

<Grid>

<GridCol col="span-6">

![Peek-a-boo Collapsed](/images/components/expanders/specs__peekaboo-collapsed.svg)

Peek-a-boo: collapsed state

</GridCol>

<GridCol col="span-6">

![Peek-a-boo Expanded](/images/components/expanders/specs__peekaboo-expanded.svg)

Peek-a-boo: expanded state

</GridCol>

</Grid>

<hr>

## Rare situations

### Icon placement

The best practices for icon placement for each type of expander are outlined above. Sometimes, though, other design considerations (e.g., content details in a standard expander) might justify placing the icon elsewhere, if the designer believes doing so will make things clearer for the user.

### Content details

Usually, content details will appear in a pop-out expander. However, they may also be used in a standard expander.
